text: Sweat gets in your eye. You lose this round's attack to wipe it off.
What should be automatic with practice becomes clumsy as you overthink it. You fail to attack this round.
You spill your ammunition on the ground. Did you do something to offend the gods recently?
The projectile breaks, but half is still caught on the string. It requires 8 Action Points to clear it.
Twang! The projectile drives into the ground between your feet. It breaks.
Bow slips from your sweaty hands and falls at your feet.
Execute the declared attack on the nearest ally, whoops! (If no ally in range, put projectile through your own foot for 2d10 hits and a -20 flesh wound.)
You mishandle your weapon, causing yourself pain. Take one round Stunned.
The bowstring snaps. Draw another weapon or restring your bow.
You managed to hold your thumb in the way of the string. Your shot misses, and you are Stunned for two rounds.
Your shot goes wild, landing 3d10 feet from target in a random direction. If someone is there, roll a +0 attack.
You slip and fall as you fire. Your shot goes astray. You are now prone and Stunned[-50] for two rounds.
Make a breakage check. If it fails, the bow snaps and you take an 'A' Puncture from a flying splinter; if it is passed, the string snaps and lashes you, doing an 'A' Slash critical.
You shoot yourself in the foot. Your foot is pinned to the ground (6 Action Points to free yourself). You are Stunned[-50] for two rounds, bleeding at 1 hit/round, and have a -30 flesh wound.
